page.title: 03HOLMESFIELD'S TUDOR HALLS
page.content: Features of the area are the Tudor halls built either on an original Angle{cruck hall}or{aula,}or as a replacement when the living part of the aula became uninhabitable and only fit for agricultural purposes. The halls were built on old trackways which crossed the area directly to other cruck buildings. {Barlow Woodseats Hall,}to the South East, stands high on a rise and has a great cruck barn with 5 sets of crucks remaining .North West of this stands {Unthank Hall}alongside its ancient Anglian aula which also has 5 sets of great crucks remaining. Further North in the Cordwell valley is {Cordwell Hall,}an ancient cruck building converted with 3 sets of crucks still intact.A footpath leads North to old{Horsleygate Hall}and from there a lane leads to{Holmesfield Hall
